commit_message:
Bug #898290: iSCSI volume backend treats FLAGS.host as a hostname

Change ISCSIDriver to set volume.provider_location during create_export.
This records the location of the LUN, so that nova-compute does not need
to run the iSCSI discovery code itself.

As part of this, include the IP address of the target (--iscsi_ip_address) in
the provider_location.  This means that we don't use volume's host identifier
(which could be an opaque ID) when trying to connect to the iSCSI target --
we use the admin-specified IP address instead.

The string-join to set provider_location is shared with ZadaraBEDriver,
which was doing something similar.  I've brought that into a helper function.

The docstring for the --host flag has been clarified.

Change-Id: I8402da86345e786a46a4d222ad4d8a4449d2bd3f

ids->names for keystone starter guide

The keystone starter guide incorrectly used numerical ids in certain places
where keystone expected names.

subject: Updated auth_token middleware caching to support memcache
messages:
[{'account_id': 5, 'date': '2011-12-02 07:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-12-02 15:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ziad,

As written this change will require that python-memcached be installed on any node using python-keystone. Should we make it so that the memcached library is only loaded if memcached is actually being used?'}, {'account_id': 5, 'date': '2011-12-02 18:29:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Dan - I tried to specifically make it so that python-memcached is optional if you're not using it (hence the try/pass on the import. Can you point out where the code would fail without python-memcached installed?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-12-02 18:42:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Gotcha. Yeah. I think you need this:

try:
    import memcache
except:
    pass"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-12-02 19:13:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The difference between 'memcache' (imported) and 'memCache' (local variable) is important and too subtle. I'd suggest renaming 'memCache' to simply 'cache', of which 'memcache' provides an implementation.

Also, if I'm reading this correctly: A) memcache will *attempt* to be imported regardless of whether it will be used or not, B) *if* you have configured 'memcache_hosts', the memcache import will be used, and C) if you configure memcache but haven't installed it, you'll get a "NameError: name 'memcache' is not defined" exception? I just want to make sure I'm understanding this and that it's the intended behavior.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-12-02 19:30:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(5 inline comments)

commit_message:
Updated auth_token middleware caching to support memcache

- Added support for memcache client (swift cache is not 100% compatible with it;it uses a timeout instead of time
parameter)
- Added the 'memcache_hosts' entry in the middleware ini file to support that.
- Moved the caching logic to the _verify_claims call (so callers don't have to manage cache)
- Added caching for bad/invalid tokens so they don't generate calls to Keystone
- Added documentation for middleware configuration
- Added documentation on caching configuration for middleware

Change-Id: I9fc30186a91559ec8d50d90e887f5ee87669d38b

This middleware was never fully functional and has now been deprecated.
To not break existing configurations, the middleware is still there
and will do nothing except show a message that it will be removed in
Essex+1 to give ample notice for removing it from configurations.

It has also been removed from all configuration files.

The functionality will be provided using the new extension framework.

Also discovered OS-EC2 middleware was copy/paste named RAX-KEY also and fixed that

Change-Id: I518baaf88a70b2b4a6f7a1038e30b256a3812f09
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecating RAX-KEY middleware

This middleware was never fully functional and has now been deprecated.
To not break existing configurations, the middleware is still there
and will do nothing except show a message that it will be removed in
Essex+1 to give ample notice for removing it from configurations.

It has also been removed from all configuration files.

The functionality will be provided using the new extension framework.

Also discovered OS-EC2 middleware was copy/paste named RAX-KEY also and fixed that

Change-Id: I518baaf88a70b2b4a6f7a1038e30b256a3812f09

commit_message:
Add templates for selected resource extensions.

Related to bug 852141; adds XML serialization and deserialization for
the following extensions:

* FlavorExtraSpecs (os-flavor-extra-specs)
* Floating_ips (os-floating-ips)
* Hosts (os-hosts)
* Keypairs (os-keypairs)
* Quotas (os-quota-sets)

Change-Id: I96ace8252f8f77612ab8c866e03eff8faee2c12b

http://paste.openstack.org/show/3539/'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-11-28 19:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

+1 for the change, -1 for the comments that Dan has and lack of associated unit test changes. With that said, this isn't the way to use -2 as far as I'm concerned. It's a problem in the patch that needs to be addressed, not a "don't ever submit" this'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-11-28 19:25:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Matt/Jimmy,

Apologies that the -2 here seems harsh.

I've mentioned this before on IRC and via email. I use -2 here because Gerrit lacks the 'Work in Progress' feature we had with Launchpad. -1's aren't sticky (meaning a subsequent patch would remove my -1) and I've seen branches go in because of this sort of thing.

Until we have a proper WIP feature -2 seems to be the best option for now."}, {'account_id': 751, 'date': '2011-11-29 07:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 751, 'date': '2011-11-29 07:58:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-30 20:01:31.000000000', 'message': "Updates simple schedule to honor strict availability_zone scheduling of new instances

This update adds strict availability_zone scheduling of new instances when an availabity_zone
option is not present in the creation call.

Setting default_schedule_zone to 'nova' will
prevent new instance scheduling into availability_zones other than the default 'nova' zone.
Previous behavior was to default the zone to None and only update the zone if an availability_zone
was supplied.  This change defaults the zone to None but allows the user to override this with the
default_schedule_flag.

In practice, if you have 2 availability_zones (nova, megazone) you can configure default_schedule_zone
on the API node to 'nova' and any instances created will be created into the 'nova' availability_zone
if one was not supplied.  Instances created with an availability_zone will be created as normal into
the availability_zone supplied.

Change-Id: Id23bac8448ea7ce6a1e1227d046c921328dbfe33
"}, {'created': '2011-12-01 14:44:41.000000000', 'message': "Updates simple schedule to honor strict availability_zone scheduling of new instances

prevent new instance scheduling into availability_zones other than the default 'nova' zone.
Previous behavior was to default the zone to None and only update the zone if an availability_zone
was supplied.  This change defaults the zone to None but allows the user to override this with the
default_schedule_flag.

In practice, if you have 2 availability_zones (nova, megazone) you can configure default_schedule_zone
on the API node to 'nova' and any instances created will be created into the 'nova' availability_zone
if one was not supplied.  Instances created with an availability_zone will be created as normal into
the availability_zone supplied.

Change-Id: Id23bac8448ea7ce6a1e1227d046c921328dbfe33
"}, {'created': '2011-12-01 14:55:50.000000000', 'message': "Updates simple scheduler to allow strict availability_zone scheduling

This update adds strict availability_zone scheduling of new instances when
an availabity_zone option is not present in the creation call.  This patch
does not change the expected default behavior.

Previous behavior was to default the zone to None and only update the zone
in the scheduler if an availability_zone was supplied.  This incorrectly
allowed the scheduler to place new instances created without an
availability_zone onto compute nodes where the availability_zone had been
changed to something other than the default of 'nova'.

Setting default_schedule_zone to 'nova' will prevent new instance scheduling
into availability_zones other than the default 'nova' zone.  This change
defaults the zone to None but allows the user to override this with the
default_schedule_flag.

In practice, if you have 2 availability_zones (nova, megazone) you can
configure default_schedule_zone on the API node to 'nova' and any instances
created will be created into the 'nova' availability_zone if one was not
supplied.  Instances created with an availability_zone will be created as
normal into the availability_zone supplied.

Change-Id: Id23bac8448ea7ce6a1e1227d046c921328dbfe33
"}]
commit_message:
Updates simple scheduler to allow strict availability_zone scheduling

This update adds strict availability_zone scheduling of new instances when
an availabity_zone option is not present in the creation call.  This patch
does not change the expected default behavior.

Previous behavior was to default the zone to None and only update the zone
in the scheduler if an availability_zone was supplied.  This incorrectly
allowed the scheduler to place new instances created without an
availability_zone onto compute nodes where the availability_zone had been
changed to something other than the default of 'nova'.

Setting default_schedule_zone to 'nova' will prevent new instance scheduling
into availability_zones other than the default 'nova' zone.  This change
defaults the zone to None but allows the user to override this with the
default_schedule_flag.

In practice, if you have 2 availability_zones (nova, megazone) you can
configure default_schedule_zone on the API node to 'nova' and any instances
created will be created into the 'nova' availability_zone if one was not
supplied.  Instances created with an availability_zone will be created as
normal into the availability_zone supplied.

Change-Id: Id23bac8448ea7ce6a1e1227d046c921328dbfe33

[{'created': '2011-12-02 12:35:04.000000000', 'message': 'Bug#899116: use correct module when building docs

Currently the wrong directory is searched for the
keystone module, requiring keystone to be installed
in the default system path, for docs to be buildable.
Also the path was appended, so the default system version
which may be completely different is referenced.
This ensures that only local keystone files are referenced.

Change-Id: I187a5153d9c8be076e8aff6bb0ae63a7c739e3e8
'}]
commit_message:
Bug#899116: use correct module when building docs

Currently the wrong directory is searched for the
keystone module, requiring keystone to be installed
in the default system path, for docs to be buildable.
Also the path was appended, so the default system version
which may be completely different is referenced.
This ensures that only local keystone files are referenced.

Change-Id: I187a5153d9c8be076e8aff6bb0ae63a7c739e3e8

commit_message:
Fix to correctly report memory on Linux 3.X.

If sys is compiled on a Linux 3.X system, it returns LINUX3 instead of
LINUX2 for sys.platform.upper().

Change-Id: I78dae37d4facbaf6513c0eab651b1a06b93949b2

By tying memcache code with auth_token we are limiting our cache options to just memcache.'}, {'account_id': 2106, 'date': '2011-12-01 14:16:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Great job Liem.  I like that you moved the use of memcache out of swift auth and into the token filter so it can be re-used by other services.  I saw the earlier comment about pulling it completely out and making cache its own middle-ware, but I don't really agree with that.  I think the cache needs to be tightly linked to the token validation and enforcement middle-ware"}, {'account_id': 2106, 'date': '2011-12-01 14:19:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-30 23:41:46.000000000', 'message': 'Implements blueprint keystone-swift-acls.

This basically refactors the swift_auth.py (thanks, Chmouel!) and
token_auth.py so that auth_token.py does purely token authentication,
and swift_auth.py does purely swift authorization and relies on
auth_token.py for validating the token.  This is to avoid duplicate
validate-token logics at different service-layer middleware.

The memcache functionality in Swift used for caching tokens is also
refactored to the token_auth.py, so that other services that may
provide a memcache implementation may benefit from this as well.

The swift_auth.py is also enhanced to include support for explicit
user access in Swift ACL, similar to tempauth.

Change-Id: Ifc0287898658e8d576dfeaafefdc5340cd321577
'}, {'created': '2011-12-01 00:35:33.000000000', 'message': 'Implements blueprint keystone-swift-acls.

This basically refactors the swift_auth.py (thanks, Chmouel!) and
token_auth.py so that auth_token.py does purely token authentication,
and swift_auth.py does purely swift authorization and relies on
auth_token.py for validating the token.  This is to avoid duplicate
validate-token logics at different service-layer middleware.

The memcache functionality in Swift used for caching tokens is also
refactored to the token_auth.py, so that other services that may
provide a memcache implementation may benefit from this as well.

The swift_auth.py is also enhanced to include support for explicit
user access in Swift ACL, similar to tempauth.

Change-Id: Ifc0287898658e8d576dfeaafefdc5340cd321577
'}]
commit_message:
Implements blueprint keystone-swift-acls.

This basically refactors the swift_auth.py (thanks, Chmouel!) and
token_auth.py so that auth_token.py does purely token authentication,
and swift_auth.py does purely swift authorization and relies on
auth_token.py for validating the token.  This is to avoid duplicate
validate-token logics at different service-layer middleware.

The memcache functionality in Swift used for caching tokens is also
refactored to the token_auth.py, so that other services that may
provide a memcache implementation may benefit from this as well.

The swift_auth.py is also enhanced to include support for explicit
user access in Swift ACL, similar to tempauth.

Change-Id: Ifc0287898658e8d576dfeaafefdc5340cd321577

Until these are resolved this branch must wait :(

commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#850377

Reworks Keystone functional tests to not depend on
a local Keystone (or Glance client) installation path.

Adds deps to tools/pip-requires with comments on
why they are needed for installing Keystone via pip.

Change-Id: I17c92e8ab37ef116d13e7b87719af4c0988450f9

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 1456, 'name': 'Aaron Lee', 'email': 'aaron.lee@rackspace.com', 'username': 'aaron-lee'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-30 16:10:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-11-30 16:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I'm getting a failure of nova.tests.test_network.CommonNetworkTestCase

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/aaron/work/nova/github/nova/nova/tests/test_network.py", line 959, in test_get_instance_uuids_by_ipv6_regex
    self.assertTrue(res)
AssertionError: [] is not true

Also we might want to come up with some way to reserve migration numbers before we merge-prop so we don't have to keep updating them as other stuff gets added.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-11-30 18:00:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-11-30 18:01:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I know gerrit doesn't honor the Depends-On flag, but I renamed my migrations to 060 so that the other change can have 059. You're welcome ;)."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-30 18:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-11-30 19:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

"Also we might want to come up with some way to reserve migration numbers before we merge-prop so we don't have to keep updating them as other stuff gets added."

Supposedly sqlalchemy-migrate added support for using timestamps instead of explicit numbering for migrations which would make all of this much easier.  I haven't had time to investigate it yet, but I would love someone to investigate what it would take to move over to that model (hint, hint).'}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-11-30 20:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Timestamps are not going to fix the specific problem I'm worried about. Having them ordered by number makes it easier to ensure that you are not going to block another migration with your commit. For example, if my commit had timestamp 3, and that hit trunk before one with timestamp 2 anyone that runs the migrations during that interim will be missing a migration(only running 1 and 3) with no easy way to fix it(rerunning migrations will see 3, and not run 2). This way we at least have a "hey make sure everything still works" warning.

I can't think of a programmatic way to avoid this issue, it would just be nice to know who is planning on proposing migrations in the near future.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-30 22:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

I'm in support of this, but I do have a few questions: why did you need to make a separate sqlite and mysql migration?"}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2011-11-30 22:16:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I still like the idea of setting migrations to some number over 9000 and then upon merging having them renumbered appropriately.'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2011-11-30 22:57:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

brian, if i remember correctly, you can't drop the foreign keys in sqlite with sqlalchemy, so you have to move the data into a temp table, delete the original, recreate the table without the foreign key constraint and then move the data from the temp table to the new one. It's stupid, but you can't run the normal migration in both mysql and sqlite."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-11-30 23:14:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

Trey is correct as to why there are separate sqlite migrations.'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2011-11-30 23:14:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

brian, the ipv6 property (i'm guessing) was removed because really it has no business being on a vif like that. Anything that needs ip information should be reading it form the soon to be created instancne_info_cache table or requesting it from network."}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2011-11-30 23:40:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

+1 for now so bcwaldon can respond. I'm happy to +2 whenever if he isn't quick about it."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-30 23:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the clarification, guys. I just kicked it off on smokestack. Will approve when they pass'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-12-01 00:47:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-12-01 00:48:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Rebased off trunk so 059 migration exists in this repo. This should fix smokestack since it looks like it doesn't merge trunk prior to running."}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-12-01 15:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Still looks good to me!'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-12-01 16:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-12-01 18:21:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-12-01 18:29:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

subject: Make run_instance only support instance uuids.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-30 04:16:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-11-30 05:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-11-30 14:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-30 14:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks for ripping my band-aid off so swiftly.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-01 05:57:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

cast_to_compute_host() needs updated in scheduler/driver.py"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-12-01 15:31:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-01 15:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Shoot.  You're going to have to pull in more changes in order for run_instance changes to not break anything else.  SInce you have to change cast_to_compute_host(), you'll have to make sure every single scheduler cast uses instance_uuid vs instance_id as well, now...  Unless you do some funky hacking in all calls to cast_to* in the scheduler.

For example:


1095         rpc.cast(context, topic,
1096                 {'method': 'resize_instance',
1097                  'args': {'instance_id': instance_ref['uuid'],
1098                           'migration_id': migration_ref['id']}})

That passes instance_id to the scheduler.  And I think if you trace this through, it's going to get this 'instance_id' argument all the way into cast_to_compute_host() which will now expect the argument to be 'instance_uuid'.

Here's another one that'll break:

1299         self._cast_scheduler_message(context,1300                     {"method": "prep_resize",
1301                      "args": {"topic": FLAGS.compute_topic,
1302                               "instance_id": instance['uuid'],
1303                               "update_db": False,
1304                               "instance_type_id": new_instance_type['id'],
1305                               "request_spec": request_spec}})

Hmm... Maybe cast_to_compute_host() could be kludged in some way to support both for now, I dunno. :-/'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-12-01 15:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

We might be talking about different things, but I think the change in scheduler/driver.py does support both instance uuids and instance ids.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-01 15:58:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

No, you're right.  It's exactly what we need for now."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-12-01 17:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-12-01 17:50:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/133/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/528/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/1903/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-12-01 17:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Make run_instance only support instance uuids.

Related to blueprint internal-uuids.

This patchset also attempts a major overhaul of run_instance so that the
code is cleaner and easier to understand (no more global-style
variables!)

Change-Id: I2289f3c253c6246ea51395b2dcfccee2256a2813

subject: Fixing get_info method implementations in virt drivers to accept instance_name instead of instance_id. The abstract class virt.ComputeDriver defines get_info as:     def get_info(self, instance_name). blueprint: internal-uuids
messages:
[{'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2011-11-29 22:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 998, 'date': '2011-11-30 16:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 998, 'date': '2011-11-30 16:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Fixing merge conflict.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2011-12-01 02:07:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It looks like you intend to pass a name string instead of a numerical id to various virt drivers.  I don't know how these particular drivers work, but since there haven't been corresponding changes anywhere else, wouldn't this break? Or are are those changes coming later?

Also, the test methods uses a numerical id when calling the get_info method. If this now expects a string, can you change those tests? They're in:

nova/tests/test_virt_drivers.py
nova/tests/hyperv_unittest.py
nova/tests/test_vmwareapi.py
nova/tests/test_xenapi.py"}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2011-12-01 13:37:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

All drivers are happy with a name being passed, as far as I can see, so I don't see any need to adjust the tests to accommodate this change. The only weird thing is the hyperv tests that pass an integer as the name.

Adjusting this across the board, so that it's clearer what type the instance argument is, is fine with me."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2011-12-01 14:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks, Soren. lgtm'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-12-01 15:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

Smokes good too!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-12-01 15:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful

commit_message:
Fixing get_info method implementations in virt drivers to accept
instance_name instead of instance_id.
The abstract class virt.ComputeDriver defines get_info as:
    def get_info(self, instance_name).
blueprint: internal-uuids

Change-Id: Ibe5e19f038e66f12711654eab48ba620aae4ace6

subject: Remove boot-from-volume unreachable code path (#894172)
messages:
[{'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2011-11-28 15:50:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi,

I think you're correct that the volume API create() method can never return a volume with id=None, so it's a good idea to remove the unreachable code. But, in order to minimize any possible side effects of the changes would you consider adding a test for vol['id'] = None in the 'if snapshot_id is not None and volume_id is None' block, then logging and raising the ApiError exception there if vol['id'] is None?

Something like:

    if ((bdm['snapshot_id'] is not None) and 
        (bdm['volume_id'] is None)):
        # TODO(yamahata): default name and description
        vol = volume_api.create(context, bdm['volume_size'],
                                bdm['snapshot_id'], '', '') 
        # TODO(yamahata): creating volume simultaneously
        #                 reduces creation time?
        volume_api.wait_creation(context, vol['id'])
        self.db.block_device_mapping_update(
            context, bdm['id'], {'volume_id': vol['id']})
        bdm['volume_id'] = vol['id']
        # Suggested change ....
        if vol['id'] is None:
            LOG.error(_('corrupted state of ...
            raise exception.ApiError(_('broken ...

This would eliminate the complicated and incorrect if clause, but still catch any unexpected create() errors that the original author was concerned about."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-11-28 18:16:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I agree with the patch, in that the db api wouldn't return None, it would raise. Since there's no handling code in the volume_create for said exception, it would bubble up to the method in question. Therefore, we wouldn't hit the block you suggest, Oliver. 

Adding my +1"}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2011-11-30 10:12:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Fair enough, since you're happy that the code can't be reached, and I do think it's good to remove the second if statement I'll add my +1 to this."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-01 06:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-12-01 06:17:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/128/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/523/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/1898/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-12-01 06:17:21.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-24 07:29:59.000000000', 'message': "Remove boot-from-volume unreachable code path (#894172)

In http://review.openstack.org/1834 it was discovered that a
bool-from-volume code path in nova/compute/manager.py can never be
reached.

The code is basically:

  if ((bdm['snapshot_id'] is not None) and
      (bdm['volume_id'] is None)):
      vol = volume_api.create(context, ...)
      ...
      bdm['volume_id'] = vol['id']

  if ((bdm['snapshot_id'] is not None) and
      (bdm['volume_id'] is None)):
      ...
      raise exception.ApiError(...)

(after applying De Morgan's laws to the expression in the second if
statement, that is)

It's obvious that the code path can only be reached if the volume
API's create() method can return a volume with id=None, but it can't
ever do this.

From:

  https://code.launchpad.net/~yamahata/nova/boot-from-volume-0/+merge/62419

it looks like the author originally had this check as an assertion,
which makes more sense, but changed it to the current code following a
review comment.

Change-Id: I9f85028675f5dac8ab23bd150869eca421fc2fd0
"}]
commit_message:
Remove boot-from-volume unreachable code path (#894172)

In http://review.openstack.org/1834 it was discovered that a
bool-from-volume code path in nova/compute/manager.py can never be
reached.

The code is basically:

  if ((bdm['snapshot_id'] is not None) and
      (bdm['volume_id'] is None)):
      vol = volume_api.create(context, ...)
      ...
      bdm['volume_id'] = vol['id']

  if ((bdm['snapshot_id'] is not None) and
      (bdm['volume_id'] is None)):
      ...
      raise exception.ApiError(...)

(after applying De Morgan's laws to the expression in the second if
statement, that is)

It's obvious that the code path can only be reached if the volume
API's create() method can return a volume with id=None, but it can't
ever do this.

From:

  https://code.launchpad.net/~yamahata/nova/boot-from-volume-0/+merge/62419

it looks like the author originally had this check as an assertion,
which makes more sense, but changed it to the current code following a
review comment.

Change-Id: I9f85028675f5dac8ab23bd150869eca421fc2fd0

domain libvirt.VIR_FROM_RPC when trying to use the existing connection.

commit_message:
Bug-897724:
Added method to list endpoints specific to a service and related tests.

Bug-897730:
Code fix to return correct status/message when an attempt is made to delete a
non existent enpoint template.Related tests.

Bug-897719:
Fixing example that illustrates adding endpoint to a tenant.

Minor code refactorings.
Got rid of additional quotes in pagination links.

Change-Id: I90470d775be87c76e4345ca9aeb7dc5f18c11410

subject: Bug #890801 Changes to support /extensions call. - Introduced a new extension reader to read static extension content. - Added additional rst files explaining extensions. - Removed functionality from  additional middleware that used to support /extensions call.ie RAX-KEY-extension - Removed service extension test as it was no more relavent. - Added unit test that checks toggling of extensions. - Additional notes on the conf file.

commit_message:
Bug #890801 Changes to support /extensions call.
- Introduced a new extension reader to read static extension content.
- Added additional rst files explaining extensions.
- Removed functionality from  additional middleware that used to support /extensions call.ie RAX-KEY-extension
- Removed service extension test as it was no more relavent.
- Added unit test that checks toggling of extensions.
- Additional notes on the conf file.

Change-Id: Ia7b47b123e94704ca5d88dcce0db4ee1ac5eb3ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-29 01:13:05.000000000', 'message': "Fixes a number of configuration/startup bugs

LP Bug#897376 - log_file in configuration file not respected

Adds a check to ensure that the log_file in the configuration
file, if set, is not overridden by the default options['log_file']
value set in keystone.common.configu.load_paste_app()

LP Bug#897382 - service_ssl not safely checked for existence

Added safe checks for a number of SSL-related variables in
bin/keystone to help support easy migration for existing
configuration files that did not have the SSL options in them.

LP Bug#897397 - bin/keystone-auth does not respect service_port
                or service_host

Replicates the same behaviour that is in keystone-admin into
keystone-auth so that it recognizes service_host and service_port
instead of only bind_host and bind_port. This enables you to
pass the main keystone.conf file to keystone-auth and it will
not bomb.

Note: keystone.common.config should go away once openstack.common.config
is a reality...

Change-Id: If2dfa57ba00758144219f8c1d42c05e56ed44ca2
"}, {'created': '2011-11-29 20:43:24.000000000', 'message': "Fixes a number of configuration/startup bugs

commit_message:
Fixes a number of configuration/startup bugs

LP Bug#897376 - log_file in configuration file not respected

Adds a check to ensure that the log_file in the configuration
file, if set, is not overridden by the default options['log_file']
value set in keystone.common.configu.load_paste_app()

LP Bug#897382 - service_ssl not safely checked for existence

Added safe checks for a number of SSL-related variables in
bin/keystone to help support easy migration for existing
configuration files that did not have the SSL options in them.

LP Bug#897397 - bin/keystone-auth does not respect service_port
                or service_host

Replicates the same behaviour that is in keystone-admin into
keystone-auth so that it recognizes service_host and service_port
instead of only bind_host and bind_port. This enables you to
pass the main keystone.conf file to keystone-auth and it will
not bomb.

Note: keystone.common.config should go away once openstack.common.config
is a reality...

Change-Id: If2dfa57ba00758144219f8c1d42c05e56ed44ca2

Added info on how to build docs to the README.

Added info in the README.rst about how to generate the documentation.

Word-wrapped all text to 78 chars or less.

Now ignores Oxygen XML editor project files (.xpr)

commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#861650 - Glance client deps

This patch addresses the dependency proliferation in
the glance client stuff. It removes references to modules
that contain non-client-necessary libraries (like
eventlet, xattr, sqlalchemy-migrate and sqlalchemy)
by restructuring the modules slightly.

Note that the additional httplib2 dependency is because
that is used in the authentication strategy stuff in
glance.common.auth. This could be rewritten to use httplib
instead, further reducing the dependencies of the client lib.

IMPORTANT NOTE: This patch changes the default entrypoint
for the Images API router application, and therefore this
should be merged along with the packaging changes in this
branch:

https://code.launchpad.net/~jaypipes/glance/ubuntu/+merge/82318

Change-Id: I5dbc8584fb77e3e011fb6ff3532f792f5103e242

commit_message:
Updated testing

- Leveraging other OpenStack code (mainly Nova)
- Enabled duration and colorized reporting
- Support for python setup.py test
- Updated testing to run with in-memory database
- load_fixture called from test (no longer in core code)

Change-Id: Ic602f7fb9be38f0aceed521c41e83a71bbc20e2f

commit_message:
Top-level commit msg for rebase: this commit represents the first steps towards
consolidating the testing infrastructure of nova.

blueprint consolidate-testing-infrastructure

Original msg: Added a testing dir for general testing code to go.

Added a new testing subpackage.

Moved rabbit and memcache fakes into new testing subpackage.

Moved the python test running into the testing subpackage and updated the
run_tests.sh shell script.

Fixed incorrect references to renamed fakes in docs and translations.

Updated Authors and fixed entry in .mailmap.

Fixed references to old run_tests.py in unit tests.

Removed debugging line.

Change-Id: I04bf860bc386bd2016e7dbc5a6f6ef7379a855bb

Reverted .po files, per review comment of Jay Pipes.

Change-Id: I9a441ccf91fd006464c2b5aa957714c1ebea40c1

commit_message:
Check that endpointTemplate ID is valid in endpoint add cmd (#897749)

Doing something like this:

  $> keystone-manage endpoint add myTenant nova

and it appears to work. We should validate that the endpointTemplate arg
is a valid endpointTemplate ID.

Change-Id: Iecc7e4057cf3009ff56624733951eb032ce7acb6

No longer needed -- I removed source_environment in a later commit'}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2011-11-29 20:27:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

It is working for me. I can call the Cisco CLI Extensions properly and the tests are passing.'}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-29 20:27:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-29 20:27:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure why the history for source_nonplugin_environment isn't sticking.  I tried redoing it but it's still not going, but I don't think it should be an issue.

Please pay attention to source_environment.  I'm not sure exactly why, but making the quantum/ directory a package is keeping the other ones (e.g. common/lib/quantum) from being appended to quantum.__path__.  So now it does so manually.

I don't see why this would be a problem, but since it should be unnecessary I want to make sure it's not an issue.

Installed packages aren't affected by this because the quantum/ subdir isn't installed."}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-29 20:27:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Abandoned

This change is been made obsolete by Brad's packaging changes."}]

subject: Fix for bug 887712
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 177, 'name': 'Alex Meade', 'email': 'mr.alex.meade@gmail.com', 'username': 'alex-meade'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 904, 'name': 'Adrian Smith', 'email': 'adrian@17od.com', 'username': 'adriansmith'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-28 21:28:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(3 inline comments)

Looks pretty good.  I would like you to address the style issue on api.py:1584, and I'd really love to hear your response to my comment on api.py:1587, though."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-11-28 21:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Good catch'}, {'account_id': 904, 'date': '2011-11-29 19:01:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 904, 'date': '2011-11-29 19:06:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Kevin

The style issue has been fixed.

In relation to your comment regarding transactions...
The lack of explicit transactions certainly isn't ideal. From what I can see every statement executed on the database happens within the context of an implicit transaction (autocommit is turned on). Generally speaking this isn't a good idea (or recommended http://www.sqlalchemy.org/docs/orm/session.html#autocommit-mode). If we were to introduce explicit transactions then presumably it would mean decorating each public facing API with a transaction begin/commit/rollback decorator?"}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2011-11-29 19:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good, thanks for the tests'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-29 19:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-29 20:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-29 20:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/114/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/1884/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/509/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-29 20:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-11-29 00:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

inline'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-11-29 01:15:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The integration tests were locking up in recv() and not switching greenthreads.  Something was not loading whatever module does the patching.  I'm open to other solutions."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-11-29 01:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Interesting.  I think we should be monkeypatching in run_tests.py, as we generally monkeypatch in the executables to make sure that the patching happens right away.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-11-29 02:55:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

That sounds reasonable.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-11-29 03:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-11-29 03:18:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Vish: I'm confused... because the only references I see to eventlet.monkey_patch() right now are in nova/rpc/impl_kombu and carrot that *I* also added during the kombu timeframe.  I feel like it _used to_ exist somewhere else (maybe in nova/service.py)... but I don't see it now.  From what I can tell, the only way we have eventlet monkey_patch is when kombu/carrot are loaded.  Ideas?  What am I missing?  (This issue is probably unrelated to this work, but it's interesting in any case)

I did move the one I added into run_tests.py with this new patchset."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-29 16:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-11-29 19:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks for moving.

The other monkeypatches are ll in the bin files
bin/nova-***'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-11-29 19:15:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

Ah, right.  I saw that.. but I was still grepping *.py for some reason. :)  Thnx.

commit_message:
Fix RPC responses to allow None response correctly.

Fixes bug 897155

Also adds a new fake rpc implementation that tests use by default.
This speeds up the test run by ~10% on my system.  We can decide to
ditch fake_rabbit at some point later..

Change-Id: I8877fad3d41ae055c15b1adff99e535c34e9ce92

commit_message:
power_on/power_off in compute manager to use uuids

Related to blueprint internal-uuids. Changes power_on and power_off of instances
to use uuids. Also, fixes a test for get_actions to be more accurate. Later a
migration will need to be written for instance_get_actions to use uuids instead
of ids.

Change-Id: Id0896f4bf3f0c64a77ac9c421bad702073f2fc50

commit_message:
Second round of packaging changes

This change condenses the directory structure to something more similar to
what we had before while producing similar packages.

It also introduces version.py which allows us to get the version from git tags
(or a fallback version if not available).

Fixes lp bug 889336
Fixes lp bug 888795

Change-Id: I86136bd9dbabb5eb1f8366ed665ed9b54f695124

[{'created': '2011-11-22 09:22:54.000000000', 'message': "Change 'zone_blob' key to 'blob' in create server.
bug 893183

The OSAPI looks for key 'blob' to check if a build plan
is associated to a create request server. But the
novaclient uses the key 'zone_blob'.

Change-Id: I85fd3629e1b3a2f142ac9296418e361aff5c5e4b
"}]
commit_message:
Change 'zone_blob' key to 'blob' in create server.
bug 893183

The OSAPI looks for key 'blob' to check if a build plan
is associated to a create request server. But the
novaclient uses the key 'zone_blob'.

Change-Id: I85fd3629e1b3a2f142ac9296418e361aff5c5e4b

commit_message:
Bug #897054: stack crashes with AttributeError on e.reason if the server returns an error

Swap the URLError and HTTPError exception handlers.  HTTPError is a subclass
of URLError, so the HTTPError handler wasn't being reached.

Change-Id: Iec86d2b345dbd37858af888bbd54a74884025eda

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-28 07:31:51.000000000', 'message': 'Bug #897091: "nova actions" fails with HTTP 400 / TypeError if a server action has been performed

Fix code in Controller.action that was overwriting the definition of the
actions method with a dictionary.  This meant that 'nova actions' would fail
if 'nova reboot' had previously been called.

Added two tests, one for the actions call in general, and one for this
failure mode specifically.

Change-Id: I695bb5c4dcfba96a5aba54125a8f3163e1a6a193
'}]
commit_message:
Bug #897091: "nova actions" fails with HTTP 400 / TypeError if a server action has been performed

Fix code in Controller.action that was overwriting the definition of the
actions method with a dictionary.  This meant that 'nova actions' would fail
if 'nova reboot' had previously been called.

Added two tests, one for the actions call in general, and one for this
failure mode specifically.

Change-Id: I695bb5c4dcfba96a5aba54125a8f3163e1a6a193

commit_message:
Fixes bug 888649

Change exception.VolumeIsBusy to derive from NovaException instead of
Error, so that an 'unexpected keyword' exception is not thrown when
the exception is raised with keyword parameters.

Add unit test to confirm that the 'unexpected keyword' exception is not
thrown when the exception is raised by nova.volume.driver.VolumeDriver

Responded to reviewer observations, fix pep8 errors in tset_volume.py,
added email address to Authors file.

Change-Id: I15464cb0cf72a2c71f430e4c8c5c2b27cd4e2ef9

subject: Use instances for consoles and diagnostics
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-28 03:20:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I really don't trust that we can correctly cast an instance object. Can you guarantee that we will *always* have a dictionary at that point and we won't see any sqlalchemy objects?"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-28 08:15:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

All the obvious uses of these methods (from the OpenStack and EC2 APIs) all pass the result of compute_api.get(), so that looks fine

However, at first glance, I can't convince myself there's no impact to the Direct API and to child zone re-routing

I'm guessing for the Direct API, we don't provide any API guarantees and there's no-one really using it except for debugging/development?

And for child zone re-routing, the result unmarshaled for routing_get() does seem to be a dict."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-11-28 14:32:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

The more I look at it the more I don't really love passing the instances over the wire. I think we'll have to do that for some creation-oriented calls but not for other calls."}]

commit_message:
Use instances for consoles and diagnostics

Use instance objects to reference instances in console and
diagnostic related compute manager calls. In addition, always use
instance uuids rather than ids in logs, and add a test for the
compute manager get_diagnostics function.

Related to blueprint internal-uuids.

Change-Id: Ibee3d309611c1999f52b77008c34879c0f57e051

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-26 19:57:48.000000000', 'message': "Refactor a few things inside the xenapi unit tests.

There were a couple of places where basically the same code was being
used to create a simulated VDI record -- these have been brought together
into _make_fake_vdi.

fake_fetch_image was stubbing out parse_xmlrpc_value, which looks like it
was a workaround for the fact that the task result wasn't being populated
properly.  I've fixed the latter, and removed the former.  This moved the
JSON handling into xenapi.fake.

There were a couple of implementations of host_call_plugin, which contained
a lot of duplicated code.  In particular, they both made a simulated VDI
record, even when the plugin function being called didn't require that.
I have brought the two implementations together into fake.SessionBase, with
overrides in the subclasses for those things that are specific to a given
test.  I have also made the baseclass strict about flagging unsimulated
plugin calls, and added explicit handling for agent.version, and a couple
of methods from glance and migration.

Change-Id: Idc3a872870ae15165747a04ecd1b48e889bd90fd
"}, {'created': '2011-11-26 22:17:32.000000000', 'message': "Refactor a few things inside the xenapi unit tests.

There were a couple of places where basically the same code was being
used to create a simulated VDI record -- these have been brought together
into _make_fake_vdi.

fake_fetch_image was stubbing out parse_xmlrpc_value, which looks like it
was a workaround for the fact that the task result wasn't being populated
properly.  I've fixed the latter, and removed the former.  This moved the
JSON handling into xenapi.fake.

There were a couple of implementations of host_call_plugin, which contained
a lot of duplicated code.  In particular, they both made a simulated VDI
record, even when the plugin function being called didn't require that.
I have brought the two implementations together into fake.SessionBase, with
overrides in the subclasses for those things that are specific to a given
test.  I have also made the baseclass strict about flagging unsimulated
plugin calls, and added explicit handling for agent.version, and a couple
of methods from glance and migration.

Change-Id: Idc3a872870ae15165747a04ecd1b48e889bd90fd
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor a few things inside the xenapi unit tests.

There were a couple of places where basically the same code was being
used to create a simulated VDI record -- these have been brought together
into _make_fake_vdi.

fake_fetch_image was stubbing out parse_xmlrpc_value, which looks like it
was a workaround for the fact that the task result wasn't being populated
properly.  I've fixed the latter, and removed the former.  This moved the
JSON handling into xenapi.fake.

There were a couple of implementations of host_call_plugin, which contained
a lot of duplicated code.  In particular, they both made a simulated VDI
record, even when the plugin function being called didn't require that.
I have brought the two implementations together into fake.SessionBase, with
overrides in the subclasses for those things that are specific to a given
test.  I have also made the baseclass strict about flagging unsimulated
plugin calls, and added explicit handling for agent.version, and a couple
of methods from glance and migration.

Change-Id: Idc3a872870ae15165747a04ecd1b48e889bd90fd

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-22 16:48:09.000000000', 'message': "Don't reference installed glance when building docs

Currently the wrong directory is searched for the
glance module, requiring glance to be installed
in the default system path, for docs to be buildable.
Also the path was appended, so the default system version
which may be completely different is referenced.
This ensures that only local glance files are referenced.

Change-Id: Ia226c90bbd24d7804401a7c9e444387c78a0f542
"}, {'created': '2011-11-23 15:24:54.000000000', 'message': 'Bug#894027: use correct module when building docs

Currently the wrong directory is searched for the
glance module, requiring glance to be installed
in the default system path, for docs to be buildable.
Also the path was appended, so the default system version
which may be completely different is referenced.
This ensures that only local glance files are referenced.

Change-Id: Ia226c90bbd24d7804401a7c9e444387c78a0f542
'}]
commit_message:
Bug#894027: use correct module when building docs

Currently the wrong directory is searched for the
glance module, requiring glance to be installed
in the default system path, for docs to be buildable.
Also the path was appended, so the default system version
which may be completely different is referenced.
This ensures that only local glance files are referenced.

Change-Id: Ia226c90bbd24d7804401a7c9e444387c78a0f542

subject: Adding UUID cache for bash autocompletion.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-21 15:29:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I like the direction of this, but there are some small functional tweaks that we should consider:

1) When booting an image, I expect to be able to autocomplete the options (image, flavor, etc). If I currently do 'nova boot --image=1<tab>', it will not autocomplete. If I 'nova boot --image 1<tab>', it will autocomplete to any of my cached uuids, not just my images. 

2) I don't think we should append to the cache on a show. If I 'nova boot' an instance, then subsequently 'nova show' it 100000 times, the cache will have 100001 identical entries in it. Trying to tab complete with that cache took about 20 seconds on my machine."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-11-21 16:35:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Brian: Thanks for the comments.

> 1) When booting an image, I expect to be able to autocomplete the options > (image, flavor, etc). If I currently do 'nova boot --image=1<tab>', it will
> not autocomplete. If I 'nova boot --image 1<tab>', it will autocomplete to > any of my cached uuids, not just my images.

I like that idea too, but I'm not sure how to implement that without significantly increasing the complexity of this patch. Any suggestions for how this could be done?

(BTW, I'm all for doing more research into bash completion and introducing a context-aware autocompletion patch down the road.)

> 2) I don't think we should append to the cache on a show. If I 'nova boot'
> an instance, then subsequently 'nova show' it 100000 times, the cache will > have 100001 identical entries in it. Trying to tab complete with that cache > took about 20 seconds on my machine.

Interesting, thanks for testing that out.  Yeah, skipping show seems like the right idea."}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-11-21 18:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Nice work. This is much cleaner than I was expecting.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-21 18:29:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm fine leaving the argument completion to a later patch, but could you remove the cache append on show here?"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-11-21 19:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-11-21 19:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Updated patch 1) Removes caching on GET and 2) cleans up the docstring a bit.'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-11-21 19:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-21 20:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

commit_message:
Bug #854104
  - Changes to allow admin url to be shown only for admin users.
  - Additional test asserts to verify.

This was implemented by adding a parameter to the AuthData __init__
(the class that renders auth call responses). The url_types parameter
filters which types of URLs to return; admin, intenrnal, public.
And in logic/service.py, there is authorization logic which checks
the caller's rights and based on that determines if they can see
the 'admin' URL. If not, it takes it out of the array passed to
the url_types paramater passed to the AuthData initializer.

Added method documentation and renamed a couple in service.py in
the process to improve code understandability. More needs to be
done, but moving the ball forward.

Change-Id: I3fb90c31617da7647a211901d647cfb53f182be2

commit_message:
Updated development environment docs.

General editing of the page on how to set up a development
environment, including:

- Documented which packages you need to install on Fedora-based
systems in order to run a development environment.
- Documented prereqs for setting up on Mac OS X
- Reorganized some sections
- Word wrapped text to 78 columns
- Removed steps to install pep8/pylint, this is now done automatically.
- MacOSX -> Mac OS X

Also, some minor edits:

Change-Id: I6f6181b3f3332fec93bc55897c7b9bdc50926908

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-23 14:03:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add keystone_tenant_user_admin option and fixes.

- Make the automatic if tenantName == userName: then make him owner
  and option off by default.
- rename keystone_admin_group to keystone_swift_operator_roles and
  allow it to have multiple roles (Admin and SwiftOperator by
  default).
- Update documentation.
- Add more logging.
- remove the timeout arg to http_connect.

Change-Id: I67e139eecd862da9cc4f1ebd0d62952ca4bfdeb3
'}]
commit_message:
Add keystone_tenant_user_admin option and fixes.

- Make the automatic if tenantName == userName: then make him owner
  and option off by default.
- rename keystone_admin_group to keystone_swift_operator_roles and
  allow it to have multiple roles (Admin and SwiftOperator by
  default).
- Update documentation.
- Add more logging.
- remove the timeout arg to http_connect.

Change-Id: I67e139eecd862da9cc4f1ebd0d62952ca4bfdeb3

commit_message:
Display LXC container console when using euca-get-console.

Actually return the console when running euca-get-console with LXC.
Fixes bug 853602.

This is taken from Xen with thanks to bastichelaar for the pointer

Change-Id: I7aff4c43be5f7137b8419f2d646e0010f2a53645

subject: Check to see LXC container can actually run properly on a host before starting. Fixes LP: 83351
messages:
[{'account_id': 1082, 'date': '2011-10-14 19:06:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hi Chuck,
  A few comments.
a.) I believe you typo'd the bug number.  I believe this fixes bug 833519, not bug 83351.
b.) i believe that your check to account for i386 on x86_64  will never run.
   The path for 'if host_arch != guest_arch' will be taken, won't it?
c.) LOG.info is a bit noisy for this obviouss debug code.
   I'd suggest a single log.debug message and a log.warn on failure.
d.) maybe rename your method '_get_lxc_host_info' as thats not really what it is doing.  Its really checking if this instance will runon this libvirt."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-10-31 17:51:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The second part of that branch definitely won't run, and I agree the name isn't aligned with the implementation.

I don't know that I agree the logging is too noisy

Finally, unit tests?"}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2011-11-24 18:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

this no longer applies for libvirt 0.9.7 due to console changes'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-14 18:07:53.000000000', 'message': 'Check to see LXC container can actually run properly on a host before starting.
Fixes LP: 83351

Change-Id: Ifb6a5799666e83cf7efbfd0d40e1b2c899c40cb8
'}]
commit_message:
Check to see LXC container can actually run properly on a host before starting.
Fixes LP: 83351

Change-Id: Ifb6a5799666e83cf7efbfd0d40e1b2c899c40cb8

commit_message:
Additional middleware test coverage

Addresses bug 888142
Adds testing for Glance and Quantum middleware
Abstracts some middleware tests to reuse MiddlewareTestCase class
Minor fixes to quantum_auth_token.py based on issues raised by test

ZNS: rebased, pep8ed and had to update to support SSL communication between
middleware and Keystone which has since been merged.

Change-Id: I5b52b646487aa0fb0aeeff34ec5ee0c0d76099a9

commit_message:
Enforce service ownership

Partially addresses 890411
Implements missed features from BP keystone-service-registration

The service registration blueprints centered around a service
registering itself and then owning the resources (roles, endpoints)
it created for that service. This patch enforces that.
Admins still have full rights on all roles and endpoints, but service
admins only have rights on services they own.

This includes a schema change (adding an owner_id field to services) which
is implemented as schema change 004 in sqlalchemy_migrate.

This patch also includes updates to tests and documentation matching
the changes.

Additional documentation

Addressing BP keystone-documentation

- Added documentation on configuring keystone, configuring middleware,
debugging
- pylint fixes

Change-Id: Ia03946ec10704882cb1ac5efac95d45ec8370e29

[{'created': '2011-11-15 12:03:44.000000000', 'message': "Fixes LP Bug#837817 - bin/glance cache disabled

This patch removes the cache management commands
from the main bin/glance client and puts them in
a bin/glance-cache-manage program. It also adds
a number of cache management calls to manage the
cache queue via the HTTP API.

The reason I moved the cache management commands
into a separate utility is that I'm thinking towards
the future, where we have a separate admin API, and
having a separate management utility seemed like the
best way to go.

Change-Id: Ic916a72f39516a06be27ea6c8ef69eb9e1a70936
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#837817 - bin/glance cache disabled

This patch removes the cache management commands
from the main bin/glance client and puts them in
a bin/glance-cache-manage program. It also adds
a number of cache management calls to manage the
cache queue via the HTTP API.

The reason I moved the cache management commands
into a separate utility is that I'm thinking towards
the future, where we have a separate admin API, and
having a separate management utility seemed like the
best way to go.

Change-Id: Ic916a72f39516a06be27ea6c8ef69eb9e1a70936

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-23 15:11:21.000000000', 'message': "Backport of socket hoarding patch. Full original commit message below

Main thing is the addition of a Queue between reading from the backend
server's httplib.Response and the frontend client's webob.Response,
allowing timeouts on either end to tear down the sockets.

Also, Connection: close headers were added to backend requests since
we only ever do one request per connection; this will tear down those
connections more quickly after the request is complete.

Finally, the eventlet.wsgi.WRITE_TIMEOUT is set in case the Eventlet
version supports it, timing out writes to client connections if they
take too long to read.

Change-Id: I1d4d028ac5e864084a9b7537b140229cb235c7a3
"}]
commit_message:
Backport of socket hoarding patch. Full original commit message below

Main thing is the addition of a Queue between reading from the backend
server's httplib.Response and the frontend client's webob.Response,
allowing timeouts on either end to tear down the sockets.

Also, Connection: close headers were added to backend requests since
we only ever do one request per connection; this will tear down those
connections more quickly after the request is complete.

Finally, the eventlet.wsgi.WRITE_TIMEOUT is set in case the Eventlet
version supports it, timing out writes to client connections if they
take too long to read.

Change-Id: I1d4d028ac5e864084a9b7537b140229cb235c7a3

subject: Fixes bug 872459.
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-21 16:06:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

easy one...'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-21 16:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2011-10-24 14:38:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What's the purpose of this change?"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-26 16:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I'm with Soren, I don't see how removing unused code meets the policy http://wiki.openstack.org/StableBranch i.e. "It must fix a real bug that bothers people"'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-10-28 16:00:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I guess I don't see the point of leaving it in? It's not going to hurt anything by taking it out."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-10-31 20:15:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm a little lost myself. Someone care to explain why it's an issue to remove dead code? We'd likely do it as part of a larger refactoring anyway. In any other scenario, I suspect the opposite situation would apply, and someone would bitch about removing code irrelevant to the patch"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-08 18:06:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

Matt: there's nothing wrong with removing dead code in general, and of course a change like this is great for the master branch

But it really achieves nothing on a stable branch except add some tiny risk of introducing a regression if the code turns out to actually be used somehow

From http://wiki.openstack.org/StableBranch - "The branch is intended to be a safe source of fixes for significant issues which have been fixed on master since the release."

This clearly doesn't count as a significant issue'}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2011-11-08 19:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

For a stable branch like this, you shouldn't think "can this hurt anything?", you should think "is this absolutely necessary?", and removing dead code is not necessary.

Still -1.'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2011-11-23 10:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Make owner the user named same as tenant/account

This maps tenants to account in Swift. The user who's able to give
ACL / Create Containers permision will be the same user as the account.

Example: If we have the account called hellocorp with a user
hellocorp that user will be admin on that account and can give ACL
to all other users for hellocorp.

If there is a user who has not the same name the account and if it
is inside the group (or roles in keystone lingua)
keystone_admin_group as specifed in the configuration variable
(Admin by default) it will be allowed to be an admin the account.

Change-Id: Icfabea296f54d8192ad2af2fb175a27c4a65ef19

[{'created': '2011-11-22 18:26:10.000000000', 'message': 'Use XMLDictSerializer for resource extensions.

Patches around bug 852141 by using the XMLDictSerializer instead of
the ExtensionsXMLSerializer for XML serialization of resource
extensions.  This will allow XML to be emitted, but does not correct
the underlying problem: many existing resource extensions do not
have defined XML serializers.  (Additionally, existing serializers,
including ExtensionsXMLSerializer, should be converted to
templates.)

Change-Id: If0fb0603920d04834368ed654f2a71d3e5300f7f
'}]
commit_message:
Use XMLDictSerializer for resource extensions.

Patches around bug 852141 by using the XMLDictSerializer instead of
the ExtensionsXMLSerializer for XML serialization of resource
extensions.  This will allow XML to be emitted, but does not correct
the underlying problem: many existing resource extensions do not
have defined XML serializers.  (Additionally, existing serializers,
including ExtensionsXMLSerializer, should be converted to
templates.)

Change-Id: If0fb0603920d04834368ed654f2a71d3e5300f7f

Fix bug #893757. In Python 2.6 xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring
raises xml.parsers.expat.ExpatError instead of
xml.etree.ElementTree.ParseError when faced with invalid xml.
Adjust accordingly.

Change-Id: I1e4ae532e001618bded2b60e554915e5d6f7e038

commit_message:
Make fakelibvirt python2.6 compatible

Fix bug #893757. In Python 2.6 xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring
raises xml.parsers.expat.ExpatError instead of
xml.etree.ElementTree.ParseError when faced with invalid xml.
Adjust accordingly.

Change-Id: I1e4ae532e001618bded2b60e554915e5d6f7e038

[{'created': '2011-11-19 18:39:04.000000000', 'message': "Fixes to prevent socket hoarding...

Main thing is the addition of a Queue between reading from the backend
server's httplib.Response and the frontend client's webob.Response,
allowing timeouts on either end to tear down the sockets.

Also, Connection: close headers were added to backend requests since
we only ever do one request per connection; this will tear down those
connections more quickly after the request is complete.

Finally, the eventlet.wsgi.WRITE_TIMEOUT is set in case the Eventlet
version supports it, timing out writes to client connections if they
take too long to read.

Change-Id: I18c7559442cf17a47ff30690ffc75010a7f003c4

commit_message:
Fixes to prevent socket hoarding...

Main thing is the addition of a Queue between reading from the backend
server's httplib.Response and the frontend client's webob.Response,
allowing timeouts on either end to tear down the sockets.

Also, Connection: close headers were added to backend requests since
we only ever do one request per connection; this will tear down those
connections more quickly after the request is complete.

Finally, the eventlet.wsgi.WRITE_TIMEOUT is set in case the Eventlet
version supports it, timing out writes to client connections if they
take too long to read.

Change-Id: I18c7559442cf17a47ff30690ffc75010a7f003c4

commit_message:
Change compute API.update() to take object+params

Update the nova.compute:API.update() takes an object id. Now it
takes an instance object to help increase flexibility in the future.

blueprint internal-uuids

Change-Id: Icc37720af1656d03ea5265544815c340f4e6aff9

To support this, I've added a fake libvirt implementation. It's supposed
to expose an API and behaviour identical to that of libvirt itself
except without actually running any VM's or setting up any firewall or
anything, but still responding correctly when asked for a domain's XML,
a list of defined domains, running domains, etc.

I've also split out everything from libvirt.connection that is
potentially destructive or otherwise undesirable to run during testing,

things separately as well as stub version of it for testing. I hope
eventually to make it similar to fakelibvirt in style (e.g. keep track
of files created and deleted and attempts to open a file that it doesn't
know about, you'll get proper exceptions with proper errnos set and
whatnot).

commit_message:
Extend test_virt_driver to also test libvirt driver.

To support this, I've added a fake libvirt implementation. It's supposed
to expose an API and behaviour identical to that of libvirt itself
except without actually running any VM's or setting up any firewall or
anything, but still responding correctly when asked for a domain's XML,
a list of defined domains, running domains, etc.

I've also split out everything from libvirt.connection that is
potentially destructive or otherwise undesirable to run during testing,
and moved it to a new nova.virt.libvirt.utils. I added tests for those
things separately as well as stub version of it for testing. I hope
eventually to make it similar to fakelibvirt in style (e.g. keep track
of files created and deleted and attempts to open a file that it doesn't
know about, you'll get proper exceptions with proper errnos set and
whatnot).

Change-Id: Id90b260933e3443b4ffb3b29e4bc0cbc82c19ba6

Currently update() takes an object identifier and a list of key/value
pairs in the form of a dictionary. To prevent further headaches down
the road it would be nice to be able to simply pass an instance obj
into the update() method. That way the update method implementation
could determine which identifier to use (integer-id or UUID).

Change-Id: I084424e436baec9571e6b7d22f2373b63be56c4a
'}]
commit_message:
Change nova.compute:API.update() to take object

Currently update() takes an object identifier and a list of key/value
pairs in the form of a dictionary. To prevent further headaches down
the road it would be nice to be able to simply pass an instance obj
into the update() method. That way the update method implementation
could determine which identifier to use (integer-id or UUID).

Change-Id: I084424e436baec9571e6b7d22f2373b63be56c4a

commit_message:
Adds option to set custom data buffer dir

Implements blueprint custom-disk-buffer

When pushing an image large enough to be chunked into either a Swift
or S3 backend, the chunks are buffered to /tmp.

This change allows a user to define an alternate directory via the
configuration files.

Change-Id: I2660b6e5a76cbfd43834384b129550b66bb9afce

Implements blueprint trusted-computing-pools

Adding scheduler support to filter candidates base on compute nodes' integrity state from attestation server
- added trust_state caps into zone_manger and json_filer common code
- added manager_integrity to pull integrity report periodic if a node is rebooted
- json_filter_integrity for scheduler to filter trust_state
- compute nodes is default to be on either trusted or untrusted pools

Change-Id: Id22ee02ddaaec89d7c8de993f04c3720dd0cbc61
"}]
commit_message:
Adds trusted-computing-pools support.
Implements blueprint trusted-computing-pools

Adding scheduler support to filter candidates base on compute nodes' integrity state from attestation server
- added trust_state caps into zone_manger and json_filer common code
- added manager_integrity to pull integrity report periodic if a node is rebooted
- json_filter_integrity for scheduler to filter trust_state
- compute nodes is default to be on either trusted or untrusted pools

Change-Id: Id22ee02ddaaec89d7c8de993f04c3720dd0cbc61

commit_message:
It implements the following functionalities:
- Filter compute api calls according to state of the VM
(defined in compute/state_checker).
- Sets error state if the scheduler cannot allocate the VM in any host
- Handles the create/delete concurrency in the compute manager

Change-Id: Ie783e9db4130ca8080f4ed57e9c0421e093f3c96
ChangeId: Ie6d016b7d4781f70bb5967f204fa88a6412bd727

commit_message:
Various fixes for swift UI.

Paging controls no longer show when there are exactly "limit" number items.
Primary actions more clear.
Styles in-line with rest of Horizon.
Filter form now pages plus some test fixes.
Better Swift pagination limit default and comment in local_settings.py

Change-Id: I288c17471624c3a90a886726af60f7c3c8f8c9b7

[{'created': '2011-11-21 20:46:14.000000000', 'message': "Put instances in ERROR state when scheduler fails.

When the scheduler's selected driver method raises an exception, such
as NoValidHost, any affected instance must be placed into the ERROR
state.  This is done by catching exceptions raised in _schedule() and,
if 'instance_id' is present in kwargs, moving the identified instance
to the ERROR state.  This fixes bug 886289.

Change-Id: I5c73549e073493701b86658569823b9bc161291d
"}]
commit_message:
Put instances in ERROR state when scheduler fails.

When the scheduler's selected driver method raises an exception, such
as NoValidHost, any affected instance must be placed into the ERROR
state.  This is done by catching exceptions raised in _schedule() and,
if 'instance_id' is present in kwargs, moving the identified instance
to the ERROR state.  This fixes bug 886289.

Change-Id: I5c73549e073493701b86658569823b9bc161291d

commit_message:
Unit tests shouldn't override template rendering.

Removes the fake_render_to_response function that was preventing
templates from being rendered. This required a number of adjustments
to the mocked obejcts in the view tests (which didn't need to be
mocked to begin with). A couple of legitimate problems were
exposed upon rendering the templates which are also now fixed.

gettext.install needs to be run on every potential entrypoint; this
resolves bug #885529 (the python standard library includes a noop
gettext library for this purpose). This is also how nova does it.

commit_message:
load gettext in __init__ to fix '_ is not defined'

gettext.install needs to be run on every potential entrypoint; this
resolves bug #885529 (the python standard library includes a noop
gettext library for this purpose). This is also how nova does it.

(cherry picked from commit 8f122d954bb35d18f0afb38aa2822cd1741f05f0)

Change-Id: I4ceaa4782461ebf6d27836336f288d79ba15cf2d

commit_message:
Remove 'location' from POST/PUT image responses

The 'location' field is already removed from GET calls, so we should
also remove it from POST/PUT operations. Partially fixes bug 880910.

(cherry picked from commit 258aa1356ca0e3e6de0b1cdd54b3736e592d3995)

Change-Id: I4f7d8d0309c8a3e10d0c2a99573ca0fa808c93be

commit_message:
Removed 'mox==0.5.0' and replaced with just 'mox' in tools/pip-requires.

I was getting an error from pip stating: Could not find a version that
satisfies the requirement mox==0.5.0 (from versions: ).

Potentially pip is messed up, but all tests seem to run with the latest
version of mox (0.5.3).

(cherry picked from commit d521d6529e0d0cdd1138823e0ee5be0e5d87e21c)

Change-Id: Id6a38766290a20d752177e8d272284b7b632156b

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-18 21:44:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes LP Bug#844618 - SQLAlchemy errors not logged

Logs any import errors or SQLAlchemy connection failures
to the glance registry log so that there is some indication
that a driver module is not installed or there is a problem
with the sql_connection configuration string.

Adds test case that verifies log output and error raised.

(cherry picked from commit 56e15f6993e85376eb6e3fb4928b0cb8f6df1fda)

Change-Id: Ib86c353350530d6de62e577df57602d1762879f9
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#844618 - SQLAlchemy errors not logged

Logs any import errors or SQLAlchemy connection failures
to the glance registry log so that there is some indication
that a driver module is not installed or there is a problem
with the sql_connection configuration string.

Adds test case that verifies log output and error raised.

(cherry picked from commit 56e15f6993e85376eb6e3fb4928b0cb8f6df1fda)

Change-Id: Ib86c353350530d6de62e577df57602d1762879f9

commit_message:
Better document using Glance with Keystone.

Addresses bug 871803 by expounding on what configuration should
look like.  Also fixes the example config files, which generally
had the authentication setup completely wrong.

commit_message:
Returning functionality of s3 backend to stream remote images

Fixes bug 860872. Also refactoring swift remote image tests to pull location data from registry now that it is unavailable from the main
api.

(Update) Fixed minor feedback for Waldon from Vek.

(cherry picked from commit 47c03a348031d25fafd56ed3c74c5376f21b1cf0)
