revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-18 21:43:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes LP Bug #850685

Handle 300 Multiple Choices gracefully in client

This patch adds a new exception MultipleChoices that
is now raised when the client encounters a 300 from the
server, with a helpful error message indicating the likely
cause is that the caller has forgotten to include a version
string in the request URI.

(cherry picked from commit 1bb0600efb444fa4d8a27e876a8c002324746c1e)

Change-Id: I3ccc2686bea30a770751fde605c78a3b7c5930b6
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug #850685

Handle 300 Multiple Choices gracefully in client

This patch adds a new exception MultipleChoices that
is now raised when the client encounters a 300 from the
server, with a helpful error message indicating the likely
cause is that the caller has forgotten to include a version
string in the request URI.

(cherry picked from commit 1bb0600efb444fa4d8a27e876a8c002324746c1e)

Change-Id: I3ccc2686bea30a770751fde605c78a3b7c5930b6

commit_message:
snapshot/backup in compute manager to use uuids

Related to blueprint internal-uuids. Changes shapshot in the computer manager to
expect uuids instead of ids. Also updates some compute api fakes.

Change-Id: I525754ea065c7df9dfe1d093e4c94c02bebf4c02

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-20 16:00:51.000000000', 'message': 'Restored developer default log dir

The default was changed to /var/log/keystone which does not exist by default
and requires sudo. I added the log_dir setting to keystone.conf so that
the original behaviour for development is restored - that is a local log
in the current directory.

Change-Id: I7939b6833c1123324a248c4cdb68817bdc40ab82
'}]
commit_message:
Restored developer default log dir

The default was changed to /var/log/keystone which does not exist by default
and requires sudo. I added the log_dir setting to keystone.conf so that
the original behaviour for development is restored - that is a local log
in the current directory.

Change-Id: I7939b6833c1123324a248c4cdb68817bdc40ab82

Converting tests to use v2

- Convert all OpenStack API tests to use v1.1 instead of v2
- Keeps v1.1 as an alternate endpoint, but it is functionally equivalent to v2

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-11-15 16:12:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hi Kevin,

Using this branch I'm now getting a failure when trying to resize:

NoValidHost: No valid host was found. Could not find another compute

Have you considered the case where someone uses the 'allow_resize_to_same_host' flag to allow resize to be tested in a single node environment?"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-15 16:21:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Dan: No, I haven't.  I probably should have stated up front that I wasn't expecting this to be the final form of this patch; I was actually inviting comments to see if people had better ways of implementing the logic…"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-15 22:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-15 22:53:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Oh, and I take the --allow_resize_to_same_host flag into account in this code as well…'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-11-16 17:38:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Pretty sure this is broken when you have a mix of local computes and child zones in the zone that does a resize.  The dist scheduler _schedule() could return a child zone host, I _think_."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-16 18:21:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-16 18:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Inhibits cross-zone queries in _schedule() for resizes, by adding a new criteria to request_spec.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2011-11-16 19:09:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

One minor tweak, but the great sin is the lack of tests for these new request_spec keys. Should be a test for each new conditional."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-11-16 19:10:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Like this approach much better (though I'd still prefer it implemented as a filter-rule :-).

Some notes:

* Not sure I really like how original_host is overloaded to also be whether to exclude the original host, though I see why you did it that way.  My preference would be to separate the two: always set the original_host--it's a fact that doesn't change just b/c we allow resizing to the same host-- and then either use the FLAGS.allow_resize_same_host in the scheduler, or pass it down via the request spec.

Noting this as a point of discussion, not as something that has to change.

* You probably should update the commit msg as you're no longer using an exclude_host argument."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-16 19:37:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Rick: I'd love to use a host filter, but the current filter design does not make it easily possible.  I spoke with Sandy about a refactoring that would make it possible, but we agreed that was future work.

As for original_host: I think I agree with you, but we're already getting a lot of stuff added into request_spec :)  Still, it's probably the better way to go, and so I'll see about doing that.

And yeah, I'll update the commit message :)"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-11-16 21:04:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I think I'll have it covered in the refactoring I'm doing.  I'll review this again in a few.."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-16 21:05:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Just be aware that I'm currently working on the tests for this branch when you do re-review."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-11-16 21:13:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Oops... thought i saw a new patch set.  I'll wait."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-16 22:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-16 22:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

This one has tests and should be all set to go...'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-11-17 14:34:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hey Kevin,

I'm still hitting this error when I use the allow_resize_to_same_host flag:

NoValidHost: No valid host was found. Could not find another compute

Full set of logs here:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/3390/"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-17 16:20:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I'll of course double-check my code by adding a few more tests, but careful visual scrutiny says that the logic is correct.  Are you certain that you're passing --allow_resize_to_same_host here?  Could you add a LOG.debug() to nova/scheduler/chance.py's ChanceScheduler.schedule_prep_resize() logging the exact structure of request_spec?  (If --allow_resize_to_same_host is set, the 'avoid_original_host' setting should be False.)"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-17 16:58:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-17 17:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Added a couple more tests, but I think Dan's problem may actually be related to this snippet of code from flags.py:

    def define_bool(self, name, default, help):
        #
        # FIXME(markmc): this doesn't support --boolflag=true/false/t/f/1/0
        #
        self._add_option(name, default, help, action='store_true')
        self._add_option(name, default, help,
                         prefix="--no", action='store_false')

Dan: Try "--allow_resize_to_same_host" instead of "--allow_resize_to_same_host=true" and see if that works?'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-11-17 17:31:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Kevin. I'm already using it as a boolean. I just entered it incorrectly in the ticket above:

https://github.com/dprince/openstack-chef/blob/master/cookbooks/nova/templates/default/nova.conf.erb#L65

The important thing is that using the exact same setup I see it passing on trunk but failing on this branch.

Using patchset 6 I'm still seeing this error:

No valid host was found. Could not find another compute"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-17 17:47:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

OK, so much for that theory :)  As far as I can see, you should not even traverse that code path, much less see that exception.  I'll figure out a test to make sure that the call to prep_resize() sets up the correct request_spec based on the flag setting..."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-17 19:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-17 19:59:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

OK, I have tried and tried, and I simply cannot reproduce your problem, at least not within the test suite.  Can you please add the LOG.debug() line I suggested and try your suite again?'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-17 23:20:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

OK, I've continued trying to reproduce the problem that Dan is complaining about.  With --allow_resize_to_same_host I do not get the error (though I do get an error about the inability to migrate the backing data).  Without --allow_resize_to_same_host on a single-compute zone, I get NoValidHost, which is what I should get.

Is there something I'm missing?"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-18 17:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-11-18 17:51:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Inline comment, but not needed.  +1ing... but would like to see Dan run tests before someone else +2's."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-11-18 20:48:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Okay. Found the issue causing problems w/ my setups. Essentially you used to just have to set the --allow_resize_to_same_host option on the compute nodes.

The way this branch is currently coded you also need to set this option on the nova API nodes as well. This is because it is the nova API server that passes the value of that flag to the scheduler via the message queue.

Would it make more sense to put the use of the direct flag in the scheduler instead? I would agree that the --allow_resize_to_same_host option is mostly to allow resize testing. Just seems weird to get the value of the flag and then send it over the message queue to the scheduler where it is actually used.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-11-18 21:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me, approved

Tests are now passing. Looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-18 21:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/59/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/454/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/1829/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-18 21:54:24.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Implement schedule_prep_resize()

Implement schedule_prep_resize() in the distributed scheduler.  Adds
a request_spec argument to enable the current host of an instance
to be excluded for resizes.  Corrects bug 888236.

Change-Id: Ia52415e79639275a06bef59f1e13ca64bf7243ee

subject: Add quantum.exceptions path to configed ext paths
messages:
[{'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-11-18 21:29:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

This is pretty subtle so I think some documentation is needed.  If a user puts the path to their extension in the PYTHONPATH but it doesn't follow suit of "quantum.extensions.foo" then it won't be picked up.

We also have to consider that we're now diverging from nova (it uses a flag: osapi_extensions_path).  Maybe we should still allow the flag to be specified but also check quantum.extensions.__path__.'}, {'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-11-18 21:29:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Fix a minor memory leak

Fixes a minor memory leak caused by a self-referential data structure
with a __del__() method by explicitly breaking the cycle.

Change-Id: Ic2c896d3067f8a2205abc8a43ec290fdbd92ef09

commit_message:
Add default for log directory and log filenames

1) Defines DEFAULT_LOG_DIR and DEFAULT_LOG_FILE to be used as defaults for log_dir and log_file.  These
defaults are overridden by config file options.
2) Add myself to the AUTHORS file also.
3) add sandboxed log_dir to templates for tests

Change-Id: I2574f5e4803f31f22ffe4de640b82a3ab68a9ccd

commit_message:
Adds TrustedComputingPools support:
Implements TrustedComputingPools blueprint for scheduler - blueprint bp/TrustedComputingPools https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/trusted-computing-pools
wiki http://wiki.openstack.org/TrustedComputingPools

Support json_filter for scheduler to select compute node candidates base on its trusted/untrusted state

Common code modified - added "trust_state" cap into zone_manager.py & json_filter.py

Change-Id: I5fd867b82735446ed03c435cf9061a4f7c374928

Updated with new unit tests and some clean up
1. test_manager_integrity is now verifying trust_state from service_states{}
2. test_json_integrity reuse test_host_filter setup/teardown code

Change-Id: Ie4ac179751276b4232e15154f34c39c32e1cae57
